title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in Wyoming

content.rendered:
When you think about Wyoming, what comes to mind? If you’re like most people, your first thought might be cowboys—or maybe even horses or rodeos! But there’s so much more to this beautiful state than ranching and livestock. Wyoming is a state in the mountain region of the Western United States, known for its natural beauty and plentiful outdoor recreational opportunities.

Finding rooms for rent in Wyoming can be tricky if you don’t know where to look! Make sure you do your research before making any decisions – luckily, we’re here to help you with that part. Go through this ultimate guide to find out more about the lifestyle, culture, best neighborhoods, and cheap rooms for rent in Wyoming!

Getting to know Wyoming

Life in Wyoming means having the opportunity to experience all four seasons every year. The Equality State is known for its majestic mountains, warm summers, and cold winters. With the mountains as your backdrop, you can enjoy a slower pace of life, but there is always something happening here! If you’re looking for rooms for rent in Wyoming, then you will instantly fall in love with the wide-open spaces and the beautiful sceneries that the place has to offer.

Related: Roomi’s Guide For The First Time Renter

Finding rooms for rent in Wyoming

Based on the most recent research, the average rent for rooms in Wyoming is $1,015. The average size for a Wyoming, MI apartment is 870 square feet, but this can differ based on the unit type. Renter-occupied households account for 33% of the total occupied housing units in the state.

Neighborhoods where you can find cheaper rooms for rent in Wyoming include Greater Sand Lake, Spencer, Greater Sparta, and Sparta, where the average rent is around $888 or less.

Neighborhoods with rooms for rent in Wyoming that are more expensive include Cannon, Greater Lowell, Lowell, and Vergennes, where the average rent would be $1,414 or more.

Related: Handling Your Finances: A Beginner’s Guide to Investing

Top neighborhoods in Wyoming

Cheyenne: Cheyenne offers a unique combination of affordable housing, exciting entertainment, and outdoor recreation. The city attracts individuals from all over the country for its beautiful scenery and exciting nightlife. With the largest population of indigenous people, Cheyenne is a melting pot of culture and heritage. If you are looking for rooms for rent in Wyoming with a small-town atmosphere that is filled with big-city amenities, from shopping malls to movie theaters, then this is the best neighborhood for you!

Laramie: Home to the Wyoming Technical Institute and the University of Wyoming, Laramie stands as the fun neighborhood with many activities to do. It has a charming small-town vibe and a friendly community. Laramie will be a great fit for you if you are an outdoor enthusiast looking for the finest yet cheap rooms in Wyoming.

Casper: A few among many reasons to relocate to Casper are affordable housing, educational opportunities, excellent healthcare, and outdoor activities. A perfect blend of city life and mountain community, this fun-filled town provides endless options for its residents when it comes to amenities, world-class museums, and restaurants.

Related: Looking for a roommate? Here are some qualities to look for!

Average rent in Wyoming

University life in Wyoming

The Cowboy State is home to some of the best public universities and colleges in the country, including the University of Wyoming. If you are looking to move away from the hustle-bustle of the city, then try to find rooms for rent in Wyoming for high-quality education along with access to outdoor activities and numerous national parks. Here are the top 5 universities to check out!

  • University of Wyoming
  • Laramie County Community College
  • Casper College
  • Sheridan College
  • Central Wyoming College

How transit friendly is Wyoming?

When it comes to moving around in Wyoming, there’s no better way than your own two feet or a bike! Although driving is the primary mode of transport in Wyoming, if you don’t have a car, you can always rely on public transportation like buses or trains.

1. Taxis in Wyoming

Taxis are the most convenient and fastest transit to your destination. Wyoming has several local taxi companies serving the residents and visitors of the state, which are affordable and easy to book with just a tap of your finger.

2. Walkability in Wyoming

With the rise of active lifestyles comes a rise in demand for walkable neighborhoods. Perfect for the growing walking community in Wyoming, the state proves to have great walkable neighborhoods and is also considered bikeable. So, if you are out hunting for rooms for rent in Wyoming, you might as well take walk around the lovely neighborhood!

3. Public transportation in Wyoming

Wyoming has a vibrant public transportation system and it’s one of the most efficient and pocket-friendly ways to get around the state. If you’re looking for an alternative to driving, Wyoming has a few options. Several bus services run throughout the state, and in some areas, there are even local transit systems.

Cultural activities in Wyoming

Wyoming is a state with many cultural activities to experience, especially for those looking to get out of the city and into the great outdoors. From museums to galleries, music festivals to sporting events, there are endless ways to enjoy your time in this beautiful state! When living in Wyoming, you won’t get bored with all the outdoor activities, some of which are fishing, boating, camping, hiking, mountain biking, rock climbing, skiing, and snowboarding. This isn’t even the complete list – there is so much more to do!

Restaurants in Wyoming

The Cowboy State is home to a variety of restaurants, each offering a unique dining experience. From Jackson to Gillette to Casper, there’s no shortage of places to go out and grab a bite. The following restaurants are some of the best in the state, which you should check out for some tasty fuel while you’re looking for rooms for rent in Wyoming!

  • Wild Sage– Try Wild Sage if you are looking for a place to enjoy some exceptional regional cuisine and the finest seafood. We can vouch for the fact that this dining experience will exceed your expectations
  • Betty Rock- A favorite spot for the locals, Betty Rock, is known for its beef, bison, veggie, and salmon burgers. In this open and airy eatery, you can have your food while enjoying a pleasant view.
  • Liberty Burger– There is a general consensus among the locals that Liberty Burger is the best burger place in the area, and we’re sure you’ll agree once you try their exotic reinventions of hamburgers which are out of the box yet tasty and juicy.

We’ve got your back!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Wyoming? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
